modules.description: This module processes configuration files that define character width tables for Unicode characters, using a subset of OCaml syntax. It provides functions to load configurations from a string or file path, supporting selective and unordered definition of character sets for specific widths. The module is used to customize character rendering behavior in terminal or text layout systems based on predefined width rules.

This module calculates the column width of strings, returning either the width or the position of the first unprintable character. It works with strings represented as the `US.t` type, which is a UTF-8 encoded string type. A concrete use case is determining the display width of text in a terminal, accounting for multibyte and non-printable characters.

This module calculates column widths for Unicode characters and strings, using configurable rules loaded from OCaml syntax files. It provides functions to determine the display width of individual characters and strings, with support for handling unprintable characters via exceptions or error codes. It is used to accurately render text in terminal interfaces where character width affects layout.
